data.title: Senior News for May 18, 2014
data.meta_description: HEALTH AND FITNESSTROY: The Troy Senior Center, 19 Third St., will be hosting a celebration with Ellio LeMaro at 1 p.m. May 19 in the Gym. He is the fitness instructor at the Troy Senior Center. Stop in and say “hello” to Ellio as he celebrates 17 years of service; light refreshments will be served. […]
data.text:
HEALTH AND FITNESS

TROY: The Troy Senior Center, 19 Third St., will be hosting a celebration with Ellio LeMaro at 1 p.m. May 19 in the Gym. He is the fitness instructor at the Troy Senior Center. Stop in and say “hello” to Ellio as he celebrates 17 years of service; light refreshments will be served. The Troy Senior Center, in conjunction with the Troy YMCA, invites you to join us in recognizing National Senior Health & Fitness Day. There will be an informational table on a Walking Program 11 a.m.-12:30 p.m. May 28 in the dining room.

MEETING

GRAFTON: ROUSE will meet at 11 a.m. May 28 at the Everett Wagar Senior Center, 2 Roxborough Road. All Rensselaer County seniors 60 and older are encouraged to attend. Lunch follows at noon with an entree of shepherd’s pie for a suggested donation of $2.75. Transportation is available from all Rensselaer County senior centers if needed. For information and directions, call Penny at 279-3413.

TRIPS

PITTSTOWN: The Town of Pittstown Seniors have planned the following trips. For reservations and information, call Sylvia at 478-3338. June 4, Hildene in Manchester, $12. Carpool at 8:30 a.m. July 24, Erhardt’s in Hawley, Penn., $42. Need 20 people for the trip. Bus leaves at 7 a.m. from Tamarac Plaza. Nov. 1, Christmas at Stormville Airport. Need 10 people to sign up.

HOOSICK FALLS: The Hoosick Falls Senior Center is hosting a trip to the MacHaydn Theater on June 26. The cost is $43 and includes the show and buffet at Kozel’s. Bus leaves TOPS at 9:45 a.m. with a second pick up at 10 a.m. at the Baptist Church in Petersburgh. For information and to sign up, call 686-7561.

FLEA MARKET

GRAFTON: The Everett Wagar Senior Center, 2 Roxborough Road, flea market and bake/food sale will be held 9 a.m.-3 p.m. June 14. Tables are available for rent inside, $10 table provided; $5 outside, bring your own table. Donations will be accepted for the bake sale, white elephant table, holiday items, household and children’s items. Proceeds benefit the center. For information, to donate an item or to rent a table, call Penny at the center at 279-3413.

PERFORMANCES

GRAFTON: The Everett Wagar Senior Center, 2 Roxborough Road, will be holding a Sock Hop 3-6 p.m. May 30. Entertainment provided by Sal Graziano. Cost is $2.50 and a pair of socks to be donated to The Danford in Hoosick Falls. Included is a dance contest, ’50s-’70s attire optional. Refreshments included. For reservations, call Penny at 279-3413.

ALBANY: Vincent Bonafede has composed a new piece entitled “Old Troy” which is featured in the upcoming Spring Finale concert of the Albany Area Senior Orchestra. The concert is at 2 p.m. June 3 at the First Lutheran Church, 181 Western Ave. The free one-hour concert also includes film scores and pop songs as well as other classical pieces. An ice cream social will follow.

TRIBUTE TO VOLUNTEERS

ALBANY: The Albany Jewish Community Center’s senior adult program will honor 74 volunteers at the 38th annual Tribute to Volunteers 4-6 p.m. May 18 at the Center, 340 Whitehall Road. The tribute includes a concert of songs performed by Marilynn Buehler followed by a kosher dinner. Volunteers to be recognized for lending assistance to the senior meal program or a special event, helping with a mailing or program, sign -in or for leading a program, class, book review or bus trip are Helene Ainspan, Judy Arian-Eson, Martin Becker, Michael Boivin, Susan Boivin, Mary Bruno, Michael Buff, Rosemary Buff, Cheryl Burack, Harrison Burack, Marissa Burack, Scott Burack, Elaine Burrick, Donald Cohen, Shirley Cohen, Gail Demarco, Joan Dober, Veronica Drislane, Jean Elkind, Leslie Feinman, Joyce Feiring, Anita Fitzpatrick, Janet Fleming, Flora Geller, Joan Goes, Ilene Goldman, Ken Grau, Marcia Greenberg, Matthew Greenblatt, Rabbi Susan Gulack, Ellen Hallen, Marilyn Hauss, Paul Hohenberg, Sylvan Israels, P. Lynne Kaido, Betty Kelly, Thomas O. Kelly, II, Lenore Kesten, Mimi Kolker, Ida Leberman, Rhoda Levine, Madeline Lincourt, Nancy Looby, Maureen Lynch, Rabbi Beverly Magidson, Asya Markova, Grace Marmulstein, Helene Marmulstein, Rhoda Morrison, Carl Myers, Beverly Packer, Helen Pak, Seymour Peltin, Joel Phillips, Lillian Rappaport, Nancy Remick, Phyllis Ross, Jack Ryan, Cynthia Schips, Norman Shapiro, Beverly Shor, Faye Silton, Marilyn Silverman, Ron Silverman, Don Treble, Barbara Ungerman, Harry Ungerman, Beverly Vener, Frances Waldman, Ruchel Weitz, Gary Weitzman, Elaine Wilcove, and Alex Wynnyczuk. The Volunteer Tribute is open to the community and prepaid registration, $13 per person, is required. For information and reservations, call 438-6651 ext. 112.

ICE CREAM SOCIAL

SPEIGLETOWN: The Speigle Elders will hold an ice cream social at 12:30 p.m. May 28. Vanilla ice cream will be served with a variety of toppings accompanied by assorted cookies. Contact Joyce Davey for reservations and payments. A brief business meeting will be held following the social.

LIVE AND LEARN

ALBANY: The Sidney Albert Albany Jewish Community Center second program in the 2014 Jules and Paula Stein Live and Learn Lecture – Lunch Series will be held at 11 a.m. June 12 in the Albany JCC’s auditorium, 340 Whitehall Road. Master klezmer musician and educator Peter Sokolow will present KLEZMER MUSIC WITH A TICKLE IN THE HEART. Sokolow will play piano and share memories of the Kings of Klezmer- the Epstein Brothers- Chizik, Max, Willie and Julie, whose story is told in the documentary film, A Tickle in the Heart. Along the way, the audience will learn some klezmer history and hear about the recent revival of klezmer music around the world. A short clip of the film will be shown. This program is open to the community. Cost for the lecture-lunch is $13 for a JCC member, $14 for a nonmember. Prepaid reservations are required in the Albany JCC’s senior adult office, 438-6651 ext. 112.

BOOK MAVENS

ALBANY: The Albany Jewish Community Center offers a Book Mavens session 3-4:30 p.m. June 18 in the Albany JCC’s Massry Senior Center, 340 Whitehall Road. Retired educator Faye Silton will review the historical novel “Fugitive Colors” by Lisa Barr. The book is about Julian Klein, an Orthodox Jew from Chicago, who runs away to Paris in the mid 1930s leaving his family to pursue his dream of becoming an artist. Sixty-Plus Dining is available following the book talk at 4:45 p.m. There is a $2.25 suggested donation for the Book Mavens session. For information and/or to reserve, contact the Albany JCC’s senior adult office, 438-6651 ext. 112.

EXERCISE ROOM

WATERVLIET: Senior Services of Watervliet has an exercise room featuring a walking/running incline treadmill and a stationary bicycle. The exercise room is open to all senior members 9 a.m.-4 p.m. Monday through Friday.
